chapter.title: どのように 仮想マシンにリソースを割り当て

indexterm.secondary: コンピューティングリソース

chapter.para: 、複数のVMが同じハードウェアを使用していることを考えると この相互作用を管理する必要があります。この章では、方法について説明します。 共有ハードウェアリソースを処理します。

section.title:
CPU
XenClientはデバイスの共有
CPU
section.para: 仮想CPUは、（仮想CPU）上で稼働するVMに提供します。 自動的に上に存在する物理CPU上のコンピューティングの負荷を共有する デバイス。
一般的には、VMがより強烈なワークロードを実行する（たとえば、マルチスレッドまたは別のプロセスで実行されているものは）より多くの仮想CPUを割り当てられるはずです。
それは上の物理CPUの数よりもVMに多くのvCPUを割り当てることは可能ですが、 それらをホストする、そうすることから得られるメリットはありません。

section.title:
RAM
XenClientはデバイスの共有
RAM
section.para: は、個々のVMに使用可能なRAMを割り当てることができます。 VMが起動すると、指定されたRAMはそれにハード割り当てられています。 VMをシャットダウンするに、メモリは解放して使用する他のVM用として使用されています。 RAMの一定量が必要です 操作は、そのすべてのインストールされたデバイスのRAMは、仮想マシンに割り当て可能ではない。

section.title:
GPU
XenClientはデバイスの共有
GPU
section.para: 物理的なGPUは、オプションで直接、単一のVMに割り当てることができます。これは、の一部です。 経験、ユーザの好みVMに優れたグラフィックス性能を提供します。

ネットワークとインターネット接続
XenClientはデバイスの共有
ネットワークとインターネット接続
section.para:
XenClientは
ネットワーク

One of the features of is the ability of a user to work mainly in one VM, but use applications running in other VMs without switching display focus. This functionality is known as 。
To use the functionality you need to install the tools on the VM and the _SHARE; software on the VM. You can install these tools using the Tools Setup wizard.

The shared application is displayed on the VM, but is actually running on the VM that is not currently in focus (that is, not currently displayed on the device screen). Any changes made to data with a shared applications is reflected in the VM on which it is actually running.

The following image illustrates a similar scenario, except that in this case an application is being published from XenApp to the VM, which in turn is publishing it to the VM. The applications from XenApp are subscribed to using the store in the VM, in the same way as locally installed applications would be subscribed to from the VM. This is sometimes referred to as a double hop scenario.

about spidering
is a self-service application store which you can use in the VM to subscribe to applications published by VMs. Once has been installed and the software has been setup, VMs are inspected to discover which applications are available to be subscribed to. entry.

security
From a security point of view, although the application is shared, keystrokes and mouse movements are forwarded by the hypervisor directly to the VM.市販 VM (that is actually running the application) simply sends the updated graphical display to the hypervisor, which in turn forwards it to the VM.

appendix.title: Installing Over a Network Using PXE
appendix.para:
XenClient
installing
using PXE
This appendix describes how to set up PXE boot and enable the installation of over a network. This section describes how to use
PXELINUX
。

uses a customized
pxelinux.0
file, which can be found on the installer CD at
/isolinux/pxelinux.0
。 This file must be copied to your PXE server.

The first step is to copy the
packages.main
directory from the installer CD to a location on an FTP or HTTP server. The location URL of the parent directory of the
packages.main
directory is specified in the answerfile created in the next step.

The second step is to create an answerfile and put it in the same directory as the
packages.main
folder. The answerfile specifies the answers to questions asked by the installer, and the location of the required packages.

note.para: Please ensure that your networking configuration is set up to enable PXE boot. For example, if you are using DHCP please ensure that your DHCP server is configured to provide the route to your TFTP server.

appendix.para: The following is an example answerfile:

Next, copy the contents of the
isolinux
directory into the PXE directory on your TFTP server, for example,
/tftpboot/pxe
。 Finally, create a file called
pxelinux.cfg
in the same directory. The following file is a working example:
appendix.screen: DEFAULT xenclient PROMPT 1 TIMEOUT 50 LABEL xenclient kernel mboot.c32 append xen.gz console=com1,vga max_dom0_vcpus=1 com1=115200/921600,8n1,magic \ --- vmlinuz quiet console=xencons root=/dev/ram rw start_install \ eject_cdrom=0 \ answerfile=http://192.168.1.1/xenclient_packages_dir/my_answerfile \ --- rootfs.gz

listitem.para:
The line beginning with
append
is one long line that should not be broken. The backslash (
\
) characters at the end of the lines should be removed in the actual configuration file.

The manner in which
PXELINUX
selects which
pxelinux.cfg
to use when a machine boots on the network is determined by a number of factors. This example simply places the configuration in the default location where it will be used by all machines served by DHCP on the network when they network boot.
